summary: The study was presented at Brock University, St. Catharines, Canada . The study is presented at the centre of the centre for Bone and Muscle Health .

The article was written by Briana L. Hockey, a physiologist at Brock University in St. Catharines, ON, Canada . The study was published on October 31, 2013 .
French Space Agency, Centre National d'Etudes Spatiales (CNES), Paris, France . Guillemette Gauquelin-Koch, Guillemete Gauqelin-koch, French space agency .
Gsk3 (GSK3) preserved muscle strength after hindlimb suspension . Spaceflight reduced bone mineral density in mice .

GSK3 could represent a viable mitigation strategy against musculoskeletal declines seen with spaceflight . We have shown that inhibiting GK3 with lithium can increase myoblast fusion and differentiation and promote osteogenic signaling in bones from mice .

The evidence from ground-based models suggests that GSK3 may be a viable target against musculoskeletal decline observed with spaceflight . To date, there have been no studies to date that have investigated this possibility in space .

We found an average 4-fold and 2.9-fold increase in MHC IIx and IIb isoforms in the soleus after spaceflight . The reduction in type IIa fibers likely accounts for the reduction in GSK3β protein observed with spaceflight, authors say .

HLS mice mice had greater MHC IIa, peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor-gamma coactivator 1 alpha (PGC-1α) protein levels versus GSK3 <sup>mKD mice . HLS mouse mice also had greater force production across submaximal and maximal frequencies .

DXA scan analysis of the femurs showed significantly reduced bone mineral content in the F group compared with the combined GCVIV control . Additional micro-computed tomography (μCT) analysis . of the tibia from these same mice demonstrated decrements in bone structure .

Gsk3 <em> knockdown could provide positive effects on BMD crosstalk . After 7 days of HLS, we found that tibia BMD was greater in GSK3 <sup>mKD mice versus GSK 3 <sup>.flox> HLS mice . A similar result was found in the lumbar spine .
Study suggests GSK3 could positively impact BMD (particularly in the tibia and lumbar spine) by increasing PGC-1α and FNDC5 in muscle .

Genetic deletion of irisin in mice severely compromises bone strength and mass with an increased number of osteoclasts . Irisin treatment prevented bone loss with HLS and accelerated bone recovery in response to reloading .

In human astronauts, the inhibition of GSK3 could be achieved with pharmacological inhibitors such as lithium (Li), which is an already FDA-approved drug . Li also exerts adverse effects when taken at relatively high doses (serum [Li] concentration exceeding 1.0 mM) for a prolonged period of time .  tideglusib treatment can preserve muscle size, strength, and quality in dystrophic mice . The limitations of our study include low sample size, particularly with the RR1 and BION-M1 missions .

Male C57BL/6N (19–20 weeks old at time of launch) mice were maintained in high-orbit (∼550 km) for 30 days in specialized flight modules . Male and female mice were launched in a specialized transporter and transferred to Rodent Habitats on board the International Space Station .

Mice were housed at a temperature of 22–24°C for the duration of the study . Male 3–6 month old C57BL/6 mice were used for the lithium feeding experiments . Trabecular and cortical bone structure outcomes were performed at the proximal tibia and tibia midpoint, respectively . Cortical bone outcomes, including total cross-sectional area, cortical area fraction, cortical thickness, periosteal perimeter, endocortical perimeter, medullary area, and eccentricity were calculated using an adaptive threshold of 67 .
